title: (x) Bauhaus Font of 1929 - various {Stephen}
content:
Here is a very interesting and stylish font from the cover of the Bauhaus quarterly magazine. Scan from Typography/Basic Principles by John Lewis, published in 1966. This is the only book on typography I have in the house, as I am a poor student. Sniff. Still, some of the typographic ideas are stimulating, and this font inspired my font Feynman Regular.   
 ![bauhaus](http://web.archive.org/web/20120717231326im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/1245.gif)   
Matthew Brown
author: matthew_dob

comments.content:
too help, the creator is joost schmidt   
Matthew Brown

Matthew,   
   
Here are some of the digital interpretations of   
Schmidt's design that I'm aware of...   
   
The beautiful people at Type-Ø-Tones did the most   
authentic Joostian [alphabet](http://web.archive.org/web/20120717231326/http:/www.type-o-tones.com/p_fonts/p_joost.htm) I've run across. There's   
a bit of history at that page too.   
   
 [Jocelyn](http://web.archive.org/web/20120717231326/http:/www.fonts.com/findfonts/findfonts_frame.asp?con=getfont.asp?pid=243426) by Johannes Birkenbach is a another take   
on the look.   
   
Those zany lowercase 'a's can be found in much   
of Finnish designer Tomi Haaparanta's work.   
See [Tantalus](http://web.archive.org/web/20120717231326/http:/66.70.183.115/fonts/fontshow/db.cgi?db=default&uid=default&ID=878&ww=on&view_records=View%2BRecords) and [Target](http://web.archive.org/web/20120717231326/http:/66.70.183.115/fonts/fontshow/db.cgi?db=default&uid=default&ID=807&ww=on&view_records=View%2BRecords), both at T-26.   
   
And here are some other wild variations, mostly   
based on the Type-Ø-Tones' Joost forms...   
   
 [Gemini](http://web.archive.org/web/20120717231326/http:/www.fontalicious.com/shopping/FONstore.cgi?user_action=detail&catalogno=fam-0003) and [Tiajuana](http://web.archive.org/web/20120717231326/http:/www.fontalicious.com/shopping/FONstore.cgi?user_action=detail&catalogno=fam-0004) by Ben Balvanz of Font-a-licious   
   
 [FF Marten](http://web.archive.org/web/20120717231326/http:/www.fontfont.de/packages/marten1060/marten1060.html) by Martin Wenzel   
   
 [Gaffe](http://web.archive.org/web/20120717231326/http:/www.philsfonts.com/phils/sectionssep00/typegf9.html) by Rodney Fehsenfeld. (I'm not sure if this is   
available from GarageFonts anymore. Many of   
Fehsenfeld's fonts are gone from their site. This link   
is from a Google search which led to an old page at   
Phil's Fonts.)   
   
 [Leger](http://web.archive.org/web/20120717231326/http:/66.70.183.115/fonts/fontshow/db.cgi?db=default&uid=default&ID=980&ww=on&view_records=View%2BRecords) by Bill Dawson   
   
Stephen

Thanks a lot... I notice none of these fonts mimic the style entirely. Since no proper version seems to exist, would it be alright to make a modern version? or are there copyright laws to stop this happening? (of course, I would attribute the font to joost).   
Matthew Brown
